intro: Meionula, commonly known as the small milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apocynaceae. These plants are characterized by their simple, opposite leaves and showy, often yellow or orange flowers. Meionula species typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. They produce a milky sap that can be toxic, which serves as a defense mechanism against herbivores. The flowers attract various pollinators, contributing to their ecological significance in their native habitats.
